availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: It appearing to the satisfaction of the Court that S. S. Smith Justice of the Peace for District Number 3rd in this County has removed from said district and County & Jeremiah Moore presented to the Court a petition signed by some of the residents of said District recommending him as a suitable person to be commissioned as a Justice of the Peace in the room of said Smith, It is therefore ordered that the said Jeremiah Moore be recommended to the Governor as a suitable person for Justice in the room of said Smith and that said petition be also certified to the Governor.

Copy attest
Wm Corum C G C C

Jere Moore
vice
S. S. Smith
Issd Feby 13 1861
